doc:
Roger Bowen https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Bowen 0 Roger Bowen (May 25, 1932 – February 16, 1996) was an American comedic actor and novelist, known for his portrayal of Lt. Col. Henry Blake in the 1970 film MASH. He often portrayed stuffy defenders of the upper class and had regular roles on a number of television series. Bowen considered himself a writer who only moonlighted as an actor. He wrote eleven novels (including Just Like a Movie) as well as sketches for Broadway and television. He was also one of the co-founders of Chicago's comedy and acting troupe The Second City. Roger_Bowen ( May_25_,_1932 – February_16_,_1996 ) was an_American_comedic_actor_and_novelist , known for his_portrayal of Lt._Col._Henry_Blake in the_1970_film_MASH . He often portrayed stuffy_defenders of the_upper_class and had regular_roles on a_number of television_series . Bowen considered himself a_writer who only moonlighted as an_actor . He wrote eleven_novels (_including Just Like a_Movie_) as_well as sketches for Broadway_and_television . He was also_one of the_co-founders of Chicago 's_comedy and acting troupe The_Second_City .
